title: Stayer Cycles is dodging the component shortage with super niche Italian drivetrains
content:
Emma Cole
2 Dec 2021

Stayer offers full bike builds with Ingrid Components

Stayer Cycles is offering full bike builds for delivery early next year with the help of a niche Italian component brand.

Due to the current component shortage, full builds are currently hard to come by, so Stayer has circumvented this issue by using parts from Ingrid Components, matched to SRAM levers.

The Pisa-based Italian brand makes groupset components and released its 1× drivetrain in April this year.

Stayer says full bike builds ordered now will be ready come January or February 2022.

On offer are Stayer Ultra Grav or OG/G+ framesets, with either 11-speed or 12-speed groupsets, Teravail 650b or 29er tyres and an Ergon saddle.

The 12-speed option makes use of a Ratio Technology upgrade kit which converts SRAM 11-speed mechanical levers to 12-speed shifting.

Prices for the builds start from £4,550 for the 11-speed and £4,900 for the 12-speed.

The brand also released new GravAlloy wheels which are hand built with aluminium rims, and available in either 650b or 700c.

Stayer says that these wheels will 'do-it-all' on road and off-road.

They come with tubeless-ready clinchers and are compatible with tyres from 30mm upwards.

Stayer × Ingrid bike specs 


Stayer × Ingrid 11-speed

  • Frameset: Stayer Ultra Grav or OG/G+
  • Wheelset: Stayer Gravalloy HOPE
  • Groupset: SRAM Rival mechanical/mechanica 1×11 levers, Ingrid cranks, cassette, and derailleur, Paul Klamper mechanical disc brakes
  • Tyres: Teravail 650b or 29er tyres
  • Price: from £4,550 

Stayer × Ingrid 12-speed

  • Frameset: Stayer Ultra Grav or OG/G+
  • Wheelset: Stayer Gravalloy HOPE
  • Groupset: SRAM Force 1×11 mechanical/hydraulic levers, and calipers, Ratio Technology SRAM 12-speed upgrade kit, Ingrid cranks, cassette, and derailleur
  • Tyres: Teravail 650b or 29er tyres
  • Price: from £4,900
